title: Step 1 – Apply for a NAISS/SUPR Account

yaml.title: Step 1 – Apply for a NAISS/SUPR Account

markdown.markdown: To request compute and storage resources, you must first have an active user account in the NAISS/SUPR system. NAISS (National Academic Infrastructure for Supercomputing in Sweden) provides national high-performance computing and storage resources. SUPR is the web portal used to manage: - user accounts - project applications - resource allocations You access SUPR here: ## Who Can Apply? - Employees and researchers at SLU ## Create a SUPR Account 1. Fill out & submit [account request form](https://supr.naiss.se/person/register/). ::: {.callout-tip} - Use Register with Federated Identity if you are enrolled in a Swedish university. - If you are not enrolled in a Swedish university or if the previous option doesn't work for you, use instead Register without Federated Identity. ::: 2. Fill in your contact details and affiliation with **SLU**. 3. Confirm your email address if requested. ::: {.callout-tip} When registering or updating your profile: - Select **SLU** as your organisation. - Add your research group, department or unit in the profile description if relevant. This makes it easier to link you to the correct projects and allocations. ::: ## Accept NAISS user agreement Just after creating the SUPR account, on the page you are taken to, there will be a section titled “User Agreement” at the very top. Just under it is the button named “Accept NAISS User Agreement”. Alternately, if you do this at a later point. Login to SUPR. At the very top it will say “NAISS User Agreement Pending”. ::: {.callout-tip} - Use `With SWAMID` if you are enrolled in a Swedish university - **this option is much faster!** - If you are not enrolled in a Swedish university use instead `Alternative: Offline via Paper Form`. Here you will have to print out, sign and send in the form. **This may take up to a week. ** ::: ## After Your Account Is Created Once your SUPR account is active, you can: - be added as a member to existing projects, and - submit new applications in calls such as **“SLU Local 2025”**. Continue to see how to apply for compute and storage resources: Step 2: Apply for Resources via \"SLU Local 2025\" --- For questions or problems with registration, contact: **itsupport@slu.se**
